channel.title: NXT Beta
channel.description:
Just a reminder, they opened up the beta to more people this time around. If your account is older than [b]1st January 2006[/b], and you have gotten membership sometime in 2016, you are allowed into the closed beta next weekend starting the 18th.
For those who don't know, NXT is a new game client that will be running c++ rather than java. This is allowing for much greater visuals, draw distances, textures, and more.
Here are some images I found in an album
http://imgur.com/a/4dl7p

item.title: NXT Beta
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I had the time to test it out a little for like 10 minutes (had to do a few things) and with the little things I did accomplish, it seemed alright. It ran fine with the shit computer I’m running on (granted I had only walked around a few places, nothing big). I think it’s a beautiful client and has a lot of potential.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: NXT Beta
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As I was part of the last NXT beta, I can say this:

99% of bugs you will find, will be graphical. Most of which shouldn’t ruin your gameplay, but some activities (I.E killing a boss that does special attack animations or graphics you must dodge) should be avoided unless you want to risk death.

I dealt with quite a few bugs last time, and the graphical ones made it impossible to complete Nomad’s Elegy.

Here’s some images I personally got (most are bugs):
NXT Particle Bug with Arrav’s Armour
NXT Camera Bug with teleporting to new heights
Hilarious bank graphic bug caused by a death in Nomad’s Elegy (I died when I killed Nomad. screen darkened and shit went whack).
“Mini” map

Read full topic

@Travas wrote:

Just a reminder, they opened up the beta to more people this time around. If your account is older than 1st January 2006, and you have gotten membership sometime in 2016, you are allowed into the closed beta next weekend starting the 18th.

For those who don’t know, NXT is a new game client that will be running c++ rather than java. This is allowing for much greater visuals, draw distances, textures, and more.
